2011-11-30.abstract: Critics say Moody’s Investors Service and other ratings agencies missed signs of financial trouble in Greece, holding off on downgrading nation's rating until far too late; Moody's maintained Greece's A rating in 2004 after it admitted lying about its deficits in order to join European Union, and upheld rating through 2009 despite growing political turmoil and economic woes; lapse offers look inside fierce debates over Greece's problems, which stem in part from prevailing belief that Europe would not let Greece default on its obligations.
